content: switching colours accordingly round 1 knit and shaping the gusset decreasing every other round 2 *k1 ssk k to 3 sts before m k2tog k1 sm repeat round and keeping pattern continuity over the from * once more 44 52 60 68 sts instep until you have 2 sts between borm and 1stm and 2 sts between the 2ndm and the gusset repeat rnds 1 & 2 until 36 40 40 44 sts remain m ending after a round 3 decrease round then work only round 2 until 20 20 20 24 sts 52 60 68 76 sts remain keeping yarn colours correct k to 1stm rm 9 finishing work corresponding round of patterning over slip all instep sts onto one needle removing both next 24 28 32 36 sts to 2ndm rm k to gusset m 10 10 10 12 sts m sm work corresponding round of patterning slip all sole sts onto another needle 10 10 10 12 sts over the next 24 28 32 36 sts holding two needles together graft sts together decrease round keeping yarn colours correct weave in ends and block to measurements k1 ssk work corresponding pattern round over the next 24 28 32 36 this should be a repeating repeat from beginning for second sock round so you can repeat the round below k2tog k1 work corresponding pattern round over the instep 50 58 66 74 sts next round keeping yarn colours correct k1 work corresponding pattern round over the next 24 28 32 36 k1 work corresponding pattern round over the instep decrease round keeping yarn colours correct k1 ssk work corresponding pattern round over the next 24 28 32 36 this should be a repeating round so you can repeat the round below k2tog k1 work corresponding pattern round over the instep 48 56 64 72 sts rowrow and kades page 5 daedalus socks - dk charts patterning chart 1 patterning chart 2 use this chart if your yarn a is darker use this chart if your yarn a is lighter than your yarn b than your yarn b rowrow and kades page 6 daedalus socks - dk charts instep chart 1 instep chart 2 for sizes 2 & 4 only use this chart if your for sizes 2 & 4 only use this chart if your yarn a is darker than your yarn b yarn a is lighter than your yarn b instep instructions rnds 1 & 2 b sl1 k3 *k4 sl1 k3 repeat from * to end rnds 3 & 4 a k1 sl1 k2 *k5 sl1 k2 repeat from * to end rnds 5 & 6 b k2 sl1 k1 *k6 sl1 k1 repeat from * to end rnds 7 & 8 a k3 sl1 *k7 sl1 repeat from * to end rnds 9 & 10 b k4 *sl1 k7 repeat from * to end rnds 11 & 12 a k4 *k1 sl1 k6 repeat from * to end rnds 13 & 14 b repeat rnds
